summary.span: 表示一个时间点，通常以相对于协调世界时 (UTC) 的日期和时间来表示。

span.span: Represents a point in time, typically expressed as a date and time of day, relative to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 结构包含一个 值和一个 属性，该属性定义当前 实例的日期和时间与协调世界时（UTC）之间的差异。The structure includes a value, together with an property that defines the difference between the current instance's date and time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 由于它精确地定义日期和时间与 UTC 相关，因此 结构不包括 `Kind` 成员，如 结构所示。Because it exactly defines a date and time relative to UTC, the structure does not include a `Kind` member, as the structure does. 它表示日期和时间，其 UTC 范围为12:00:00 午夜，0001年1月1日午夜，到 11:59:59 P.M，年12月31日，9999公元It represents dates and times with values whose UTC ranges from 12:00:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 Anno Domini (Common Era), to 11:59:59 P.M., December 31, 9999 A.D. （公历）。(C.E.). [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 值的时间部分以100毫微秒为单位进行度量，其中，特定日期为自公元0001年1月1日午夜12:00 午夜后的计时周期数。The time component of a value is measured in 100-nanosecond units called ticks, and a particular date is the number of ticks since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 A.D. 公元在 日历中。(C.E.) in the calendar. 值始终在显式或默认日历的上下文中表示。A value is always expressed in the context of an explicit or default calendar. 对于闰秒而言，计时周期的总刻度不包括在内。Ticks that are attributable to leap seconds are not included in the total number of ticks. 尽管 值包含偏移量，但它不是完全时区感知数据结构。Although a value includes an offset, it is not a fully time zone-aware data structure. 尽管与 UTC 的偏移量是时区的一个特征，但它不能明确标识时区。While an offset from UTC is one characteristic of a time zone, it does not unambiguously identify a time zone. 不仅有多个时区与 UTC 有相同的偏移，而且单个时区的偏移量会随着夏令时的变化而变化。Not only do multiple time zones share the same offset from UTC, but the offset of a single time zone changes if it observes daylight saving time. 这意味着，只要 值与时区解除关联，就不能再明确地链接回其原始时区。This means that, as soon as a value is disassociated from its time zone, it can no longer be unambiguously linked back to its original time zone. 由于 是一个结构，已声明但未初始化的 对象包含其每个成员字段的默认值。Because is a structure, a object that has been declared but not otherwise initialized contains the default values for each of its member fields. 这意味着其 属性设置为 ，其 属性设置为 。This means that its property is set to and its property is set to . 可以通过调用其构造函数的任何重载来创建新的 值，这类似于 结构的重载构造函数。You can create a new value by calling any of the overloads of its constructor, which are similar to the overloaded constructors for the structure. 还可以通过为其分配一个 值来创建新的 值。You can also create a new value by assigning it a value. 这是一个隐式转换;它不需要强制转换运算符（在中C#）或对转换方法的调用（在 Visual Basic 中）。This is an implicit conversion; it does not require a casting operator (in C#) or call to a conversion method (in Visual Basic). 还可以通过调用一些静态字符串分析方法（包括 、、和 ），从日期和时间的字符串表示形式初始化 值。You can also initialize a value from the string representation of a date and time by calling a number of static string parsing methods, which include , , , and . 结构的成员在以下方面提供功能：The members of the structure provide functionality in the following areas: - 日期和时间算术。Date and time arithmetic. 可以从特定 值中添加或减少日期或时间间隔。You can add or subtract either dates or time intervals from a particular value. 使用 值的算术运算（与具有 值的值不同）在返回结果时调整时间偏移差异。Arithmetic operations with values, unlike those with values, adjust for differences in time offsets when returning a result. 例如，下面的代码使用 变量从当前 UTC 时间减去当前本地时间。For example, the following code uses variables to subtract the current local time from the current UTC time. 然后，该代码使用 变量来执行相同的操作。The code then uses variables to perform the same operation. 与 值的减法返回本地时区与 UTC 之间的时差，而与 值的减法返回 。The subtraction with values returns the local time zone's difference from UTC, while the subtraction with values returns . [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Type#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Type/cs/Type.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Type#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Type/vb/Type.vb#1)] - 类型转换操作。Type conversion operations. 您可以将 值转换为 值，反之亦然。You can convert values to values and vice versa. - 时间操作和提取操作。Time manipulation and extraction operations. 可以提取 值的日期或时间。You can extract either the date or the time of a value. 还可以检索特定 组件的值，例如其年份或月份。You can also retrieve the value of a particular component, such as its year or its month. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用的计时周期值要转换为其他时间间隔（如分钟或秒），则应使用 、、、或 常量来执行转换。If you are working with a ticks value that you want to convert to some other time interval, such as minutes or seconds, you should use the , , , , or constant to perform the conversion. 例如，若要将指定的刻度数表示的秒数添加到 值的 部分，可以使用表达式 `dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`。For example, to add the number of seconds represented by a specified number of ticks to the component of a value, you can use the expression `dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`. - 日期和时间转换。Date and time conversion. 可以将任何 值转换为另一个 值，该值表示另一个时区中的同一时间点。You can convert any value to another value that represents the same point in time in another time zone. 但是，时区的调整规则仅适用于 方法，该方法将 值转换为本地系统区域中的日期和时间。However, a time zone's adjustment rules are applied only in the case of the method, which converts a value to the date and time in the local system zone. - 日期和时间的比较。Date and time comparison. 您可以确定任何特定 值是早于、等于还是晚于另一个 值。You can determine whether any particular value is earlier than, the same as, or later than another value. 在执行比较之前，所有值都将转换为 UTC。Before the comparison is performed, all values are converted to UTC.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `year`、`month`、`day`、`hour`、`minute`、`second`和 `millisecond` 参数均反映以 `calendar` 参数指定的日历表示的值。The `year`, `month`, `day`, `hour`, `minute`, `second`, and `millisecond` parameters all reflect values expressed in the calendar specified by the `calendar` parameter. 如果这些值构成无法使用此日历表示的日期和时间，则会引发异常。An exception is thrown if these values form a date and time that cannot be expressed by using this calendar. [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] ## Examples 下面的示例使用 类和 类的实例来实例化 值。The following example uses instances of both the class and the class to instantiate a value. 然后，使用相应的日历和公历向控制台显示该日期。That date is then displayed to the console using the respective calendars and the Gregorian calendar. remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以在单个操作中使用 方法添加多种时间间隔（天、小时、分钟、秒或毫秒）。You can use the method to add more than one kind of time interval (days, hours, minutes, seconds, or milliseconds) in a single operation. 此方法的行为与加法运算符相同。This method's behavior is identical to the addition operator. 结构还支持每个时间间隔的专用加法方法（如 、和 ）。The structure also supports specialized addition methods (such as , , and ) for each time interval. > [!NOTE] > 此方法返回新的 对象。This method returns a new object. 它不会通过将 `timeSpan` 添加到其日期和时间来修改当前对象的值。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `timeSpan` to its date and time. 方法不会影响当前 对象的 属性的值。The method does not affect the value of the current object's property. 由于 对象不表示特定时区中的日期和时间，因此 方法在执行日期和时间算术时不会考虑特定时区的调整规则。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic. 如果 `null``timeSpan` 参数，则此方法返回未更改的原始 对象的值。If the `timeSpan` parameter is `null`, this method returns the value of the original object unchanged. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个 对象的数组，这些对象表示目标间的航班时间。The following example creates an array of objects that represent the flight times between destinations. 然后 方法将这些时间添加到表示航班初始起飞时间的 对象中。The method then adds these times to a object that represents a flight's initial takeoff time. 结果反映每个目标的计划的到达时间。The result reflects the scheduled arrival time at each destination. remarks.format: ## Remarks `days` 参数的小数部分是一天中的小数部分。The fractional part of the `days` parameter is the fractional part of a day. 例如，4.5 相当于4天，12小时，0分钟，0毫秒，0毫秒。For example, 4.5 is equivalent to 4 days, 12 hours, 0 minutes, 0 seconds, 0 milliseconds. `days` 参数舍入为最接近的毫秒。The `days` parameter is rounded to the nearest millisecond. > [!NOTE] > 此方法返回新的 对象。This method returns a new object. 它不会通过将 `days` 添加到其日期和时间来修改当前对象的值。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `days` to its date and time. 由于 对象不表示特定时区中的日期和时间，因此 方法在执行日期和时间算术时不会考虑特定时区的调整规则。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic. 将少于一天的时间间隔转换为分数可能会损失精度。Converting time intervals of less than a day to a fraction can involve a loss of precision. 如果这有问题，则可以使用 方法，该方法使你能够在单个方法调用中指定多个时间间隔，并且无需将时间间隔转换为一天中的小数部分。If this is problematic, you can use the method, which enables you to specify more than one kind of time interval in a single method call and eliminates the need to convert time intervals to fractional parts of a day. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法列出了2008年3月的星期一（工作周开始时间）的日期。The following example uses the method to list the dates that fall on Monday, the start of the work week, in March 2008. remarks.format: ## Remarks `hours` 参数的小数部分是一个小时的小数部分。The fractional part of the `hours` parameter is the fractional part of an hour. 例如，4.5 等效于4小时30分钟0秒0毫秒。For example, 4.5 is equivalent to 4 hours, 30 minutes, 0 seconds, 0 milliseconds. `hours` 参数舍入为最接近的毫秒。The `hours` parameter is rounded to the nearest millisecond. > [!NOTE] > 此方法返回新的 对象。This method returns a new object. 它不会通过将 `hours` 添加到其日期和时间来修改当前对象的值。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `hours` to its date and time. 由于 对象不表示特定时区中的日期和时间，因此 方法在执行日期和时间算术时不会考虑特定时区的调整规则。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic. 将少于1小时的时间间隔转换为分数可能会损失精度。Converting time intervals of less than an hour to a fraction can involve a loss of precision. （例如，一分钟为0.01666 小时。）如果这有问题，则可以使用 方法，该方法允许您在单个方法调用中指定多个时间间隔，并且无需将时间间隔转换为一小时的小数部分。(For example, one minute is 0.01666 of an hour.) remarks.format: ## Remarks 勾选标记表示100毫微秒，或 1-10 秒秒。A tick represents 100 nanoseconds, or one-ten millionth of a second. 因为计时周期是非常小且精确的时间间隔，所以任何更大的时间单位都可以表示为多个刻度，而不会丢失精度。Because a tick is a very small and precise time interval, any larger time unit can be expressed as a number of ticks without a loss of precision. > [!NOTE] > 此方法返回新的 对象。This method returns a new object. 它不会通过将 `minutes` 添加到其日期和时间来修改当前对象的值。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `minutes` to its date and time. 下表列出了特定时间间隔内的计时周期数。The following table lists the number of ticks in a particular time interval. |时间间隔Time interval|计时周期数Number of ticks| |-------------------|---------------------| |秒Second|10,000,00010,000,000| |MinuteMinute|600,000,000600,000,000| |小时Hour|36,000,000,00036,000,000,000| |日期Day|864,000,000,000864,000,000,000| |周Week|6,048,000,000,0006,048,000,000,000| |月Month|取决于月中的天数。Depends on number of days in the month.| |非闰年Non-leap year|315,360,000,000,000315,360,000,000,000| |闰年Leap year|316,224,000,000,000316,224,000,000,000| 由于 对象不表示特定时区中的日期和时间，因此 方法在执行日期和时间算术时不会考虑特定时区的调整规则。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性将从 对象中移除时间部分的任何重要部分，并只返回其重要的日期部分。This property removes any significant part of the time component from a object and returns only its significant date component. 例如，如果 对象的日期和时间值为 "1/12/07 4： 01pm + 7:30"，则属性将返回 值 "1/12/07 12:00:00 AM"。For example, if the object has a date and time value of "1/12/07 4:01pm +7:30", the property returns a value of "1/12/07 12:00:00 AM". 然后，可以使用仅显示日期的任何标准或自定义格式说明符来显示 值。The value can then be displayed by using any of the standard or custom format specifiers that display dates only. （有关说明，请参阅 "示例" 部分。）(See the Example section for an illustration.) 返回的 对象的 属性的值始终是 的。The value of the property of the returned object is always . 它不受 属性的值的影响。It is not affected by the value of the property. 若要显示日期而不显示其时间组成部分，还可以使用 "D" 或 "d" 格式说明符;有关说明，请参阅 "示例" 部分。To display a date without its time component, you can also use the "D" or "d" format specifiers; for an illustration, see the Example section. ## Examples 下面的示例检索特定日期的 属性的值。The following example retrieves the value of the property for a specific date. 然后，它使用一些标准的和自定义的日期格式说明符向控制台显示该值。It then displays that value to the console using some standard and custom date-only format specifiers. Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 当应用程序创建、访问或写入到文件时，Windows 将使用文件时间来记录。Windows uses a file time to record when an application creates, accesses, or writes to a file. Windows 文件时间通过调用 `GetFileTime` 函数（该函数将返回 `FILETIME` 结构）直接通过 Windows API 进行访问。A Windows file time is directly accessible through the Windows API by calling the `GetFileTime` function, which returns a `FILETIME` structure. 单个函数参数是要检索其文件时间信息的文件的句柄。The single function parameter is the handle of the file whose file time information is to be retrieved. 文件句柄是通过调用 `CreateFile` 函数来检索的。The file handle is retrieved by calling the `CreateFile` function. `FILETIME` 结构的 `dwHighDateTime` 成员包含文件时间的四个高序位字节，其 `dwLowDateTime` 成员包含四个低序位字节。The `FILETIME` structure's `dwHighDateTime` member contains the four high-order bytes of the file time, and its `dwLowDateTime` member contains the four low-order bytes. 下面的示例演示了如何检索 Windows 文件时间值并将其转换为 值。The example that follows illustrates how to retrieve Windows file time values and convert them to values. 还可以通过调用 和 方法，并通过调用 方法从 值创建 Windows 文件时间值 值。Windows file time values can also be created from values by calling the and methods, and from values by calling the method. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 Windows API 检索 WordPad 可执行文件的 Windows 文件时间。The following example uses the Windows API to retrieve the Windows file times for the WordPad executable. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如有必要， 属性会将当前 对象的日期和时间转换为本地系统的日期和时间。If necessary, the property converts the current object's date and time to the local system's date and time. 转换是一个两步操作：The conversion is a two-step operation: 1. 属性将当前 对象的时间转换为协调世界时（UTC）。The property converts the current object's time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 2. 然后，属性将 UTC 转换为本地时间。The property then converts UTC to local time. 没有无效的时间，不明确的时间将映射到本地区域的标准时间。There are no invalid times and ambiguous times are mapped to the local zone's standard time. （但是，转换可能会产生异常：如果从本地计算机派生的 值反映了不明确的日期和时间，则可以将该值转换为 UTC，然后返回到与原始时间不同的本地时间。） 当执行此转换时，属性将在本地时区中应用任何调整规则。(However, the conversion can create an anomaly: if a value that is derived from the local computer reflects an ambiguous date and time, that value can be converted to UTC and then back to a local time that differs from the original time.) The property applies any adjustment rules in the local time zone when it performs this conversion. 此属性同时返回 对象的日期和时间部分，这使 转换非常有用。This property returns both the date and the time component of a object, which makes it useful for to conversion. 除了执行任何必要的时间转换以外，此属性还可以通过将返回的 对象的 属性的值设置为 来与 属性不同。In addition to performing any necessary time conversion, this property differs from the property by setting the value of the property of the returned object to . ## Examples 下面的示例演示了在美国太平洋标准时区，将 值转换为本地时间。The following example illustrates several conversions of values to local times in the U.S. Pacific Standard Time zone. 请注意，最后三次都不明确;属性将所有这些属性映射到太平洋标准时区中的单个日期和时间。Note that the last three times are all ambiguous; the property maps all of them to a single date and time in the Pacific Standard Time zone. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此常量的值为 12/31/9999 11:59:59 PM + 00:00。The value of this constant is 12/31/9999 11:59:59 PM +00:00. 属性用于确定新 对象的值或算术运算返回的 值是否与此最大范围值相同或更早。The property is used to determine whether the value of a new object or the value returned by an arithmetic operation is the same as or earlier than this maximum range value. 如果不是，则该方法引发 。If it is not, the method throws an . 任何 值都将转换为协调世界时（UTC），然后该方法才会将其与 进行比较。Any value is converted to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) before the method compares it with . 这意味着，日期和时间接近最大范围但偏移量为负的 值可能会引发异常。This means that a value whose date and time are close to the maximum range, but whose offset is negative, may throw an exception. 例如，值 12/31/9999 11:00 PM-02:00 超出范围，这是因为它在转换为 UTC 时比 晚一小时。For example, the value 12/31/9999 11:00 PM -02:00 is out of range because it is one hour later than when it is converted to UTC. 某些日历（如 ）支持早于 之前的日期范围。Some calendars, such as the , support an upper date range that is earlier than . 在这些情况下，尝试访问变量赋值或格式设置和分析操作中的 可能会引发 。In these cases, trying to access in variable assignments or formatting and parsing operations can throw an . 您可以从 属性中检索指定区域性的最新有效日期值，而不是检索 的值。Instead of retrieving the value of , you can retrieve the value of the specified culture's latest valid date value from the property.

exception.span: 位于当前或指定区域性的默认日历的范围之外。

span.span: is outside the range of the current or specified culture's default calendar.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 方法，编译器可以自动将 对象转换为 对象，而无需使用显式强制转换运算符C#（在中）或调用转换函数（在 Visual Basic 中）。The method enables the compiler to automatically convert a object to a object without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它定义了不涉及数据丢失的扩大转换，并且不会引发 。It defines a widening conversion that does not involve data loss and does not throw an . 方法会使代码如下所示：The method makes code such as the following possible: [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Operators#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Operators/cs/Operators.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Operators#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Operators/vb/Operators.vb#7)] 此方法等效于 构造函数。This method is equivalent to the constructor. 生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `dateTime` 参数的 属性值：The offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the property of the `dateTime` parameter: - 如果 属性的值，则将 对象的日期和时间设置为 `dateTime`，并将其 属性设置为等于0。If the value of the property is , the date and time of the object is set equal to `dateTime`, and its property is set equal to 0. - 如果 属性的值为 或 ，则将 对象的日期和时间设置为等于 `dateTime`，并将其 属性设置为等于本地系统的当前时区的偏移量。If the value of the property is or , the date and time of the object is set equal to `dateTime`, and its property is set equal to the offset of the local system's current time zone. 此运算符的等效方法是 The equivalent method for this operator is

remarks.format: ## Remarks 分析一个字符串，其中包含三个元素，这些元素可按任意顺序出现并由空格分隔。 parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 这三个元素如下表中所示。These three elements are as shown in the following table. |元素Element|示例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<时间 >\|"1:02:03 PM""1:02:03 PM"| |\<偏移 >\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 尽管其中的每个元素都是可选的，但 > \<偏移量不能单独出现。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必须与 \<日期 > 或 \<时间 > 一起提供。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果缺少 \<日期 >，则其默认值为当前日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果缺少 \<时间 >，则其默认值为 12:00:00 AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果存在 \<日期 > 但其年份组成部分只包含两个数字，则将根据 属性的值将其转换为当前区域性当前日历中的年份。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the current culture's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果缺少 \，则其默认值为本地时区的偏移量。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone. \ 可以表示与协调世界时（UTC）之间的负值或正偏移量。\ can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情况下，\<偏移 > 必须包括符号符号。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol. `input` 字符串使用为当前区域性初始化 对象中的格式设置信息进行分析。The `input` string is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current culture. 若要分析包含指定格式的字符串，该字符串不一定对应于当前区域性的格式设置，请使用 方法并提供格式说明符。To parse a string that contains designated formatting that does not necessarily correspond to the formatting of the current culture, use the method and provide a format specifier. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法来分析多个日期和时间字符串。The following example calls the method to parse several date and time strings. 该示例包括从2007年3月22日到区域性为 en-us 的系统的输出。The example includes output from March 22, 2007, on a system whose culture is en-us. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析日期的字符串表示形式，该日期必须采用 `format` 参数定义的格式。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它还要求日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移 > 元素按 `format`指定的顺序出现。It also requires that the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果 `input` 字符串与此 `format` 参数不匹配，则该方法将引发一个 。If the `input` string does not match this `format` parameter, the method throws a . 与此相反， 方法会分析格式提供程序的 对象识别的任何格式的日期的字符串表示形式。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 还允许以任意顺序显示日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移量。 also allows the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time to appear in any order. `format` 参数是包含单个标准格式说明符的字符串，或是一个或多个定义 `input` 参数所需格式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of the `input` parameter. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `format` 包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移必须包含负号或正号。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则方法会引发 。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含时间而不包含日期，则生成的 对象将被分配到本地系统上的当前日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则会为生成的 对象分配本地系统的时区偏移量。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the resulting object is assigned the time zone offset of the local system. `input` the precise format of `input` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示基于其解释 `input` 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用带有标准和自定义格式说明符的 方法以及用于分析多个日期和时间字符串的固定区域性。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers and the invariant culture to parse several date and time strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法分析表示日期的字符跨度，该日期必须采用 `format` 参数所定义的格式。This method parses a character span that represents a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它还要求日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移 > 元素按 `format`指定的顺序出现。It also requires that the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果 `input` 与 `format` 模式不匹配，则该方法将引发一个 。If `input` does not match the `format` pattern, the method throws a . 与此相反， 方法会分析格式提供程序的 对象识别的任何格式的日期的字符串表示形式。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 还允许以任意顺序显示日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移量。 also allows the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time to appear in any order. `format` 参数是一个字符跨度，其中包含单字符标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 `input` 参数所需格式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a character span that contains either a single-character standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of the `input` parameter. Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `format` 包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移必须包含负号或正号。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则方法会引发 。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 其 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中的符号和格式设置。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - 一个 remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法分析表示日期的字符跨度，该日期与分配给 `formats` 参数的模式之一匹配。This method parses a character span representing a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` parameter. 如果 `input` `styles` 与上述任意一种模式都不匹配，则该方法将引发一个 。If `input` does not match any one of these patterns with any of the variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the method throws a . 除了将 `input` 与多个格式设置模式进行比较以外，此重载的行为与 方法相同。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple formatting patterns, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 `input` 参数的可能模式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of the `input` parameter. 调用方法时，`input` 必须匹配其中一种模式。When the method is called, `input` must match one of these patterns. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配的元素包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移量必须包括负号或正负号。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则方法会引发 。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用此重载的 `formats` 参数指定多种格式可帮助减少许多用户在输入日期和时间时遇到的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特别是，定义多个输入模式的功能使应用程序能够处理日期和时间表示形式，该表示形式可以包括或缺少前导零（以月、天、小时、分钟和秒为单位）。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求 `input` 包含时间而不包含日期，则生成的 对象将被分配到本地系统上的当前日期。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `styles` 参数的值。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将本地时区的偏移量分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将协调世界时（UTC）偏移量或 + 00:00 分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果这两个值均未指定，则使用本地时区的偏移量。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. `input` 中使用的特定日期和时间符号和字符串由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 如果 `formats` 的匹配元素是标准格式说明符字符串，则 `input`的精确格式也是如此。The same is true for the precise format of `input`, if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示基于其解释 `input` 的区域性。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中的符号和格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles` 参数定义在输入字符串中是否允许空格，指示如何分析没有显式偏移量组件的字符串，并支持在分析操作中进行 UTC 转换。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is permitted in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 除 之外，还支持 枚举的所有成员。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出了每个受支持的成员的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成员`DateTimeStyles` member|行为Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||分析 `input`，并在必要时将其转换为 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它等效于分析字符串，然后调用返回的 对象的 方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供本地时区的偏移量。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 这是默认值。This is the default value.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供 UTC 偏移量（+ 00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的内部空格。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by `format`. 在对字符串进行分析时，日期和时间部分之间以及单个组件中可能出现额外的空白。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except the offset), and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `formats`未指定的前导空格。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `formats`未指定的尾随空格。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`未指定的前导空格、尾随空格和内部空格。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略在 `formats` 中的匹配元素中未指定的所有额外空白字符。All extra white-space characters not specified in the matched element in `formats` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||指示 `input`中不允许使用额外的空白。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空格必须完全按照 `formats` 的特定元素中的指定显示，才能发生匹配。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element of `formats` for a match to occur. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||不起作用，因为 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析日期的字符串表示形式，该日期必须采用 `format` 参数定义的格式。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它还要求日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移 > 元素按 `format`指定的顺序出现。It also requires that the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果 `input` 字符串与 `format` 参数的模式不匹配，并且具有 `styles` 参数定义的任何变体，则该方法将引发 。If the `input` string does not match the pattern of the `format` parameter, with any variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the method throws a . 与此相反， 方法会分析格式提供程序的 对象识别的任何格式的日期的字符串表示形式。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 还允许以任意顺序显示日期和时间的字符串表示形式的 \<日期 >、\<时间 > 和 \<偏移量。 also allows the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time to appear in any order. `format` 参数是包含单个标准格式说明符的字符串，或者是一个或多个定义 `input` 参数所需模式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required pattern of the `input` parameter. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `format` 包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移必须包含负号或正号。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则方法会引发 。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含时间而不包含日期，则生成的 对象将被分配到本地系统上的当前日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `styles` 参数的值。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将本地时区的偏移量分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将协调世界时（UTC）偏移量或 + 00:00 分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果这两个值均未指定，则使用本地时区的偏移量。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. `input` 中使用的特定日期和时间符号和字符串由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 如果 `format` 是标准格式说明符字符串，则 `input`的精确格式也是如此。The same is true for the precise format of `input`, if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示基于其解释 `input` 的区域性。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中的符号和格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles` 参数定义在输入字符串中是否允许空格，指示如何分析没有显式偏移量组件的字符串，并支持在分析操作中进行 UTC 转换。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is allowed in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 除 之外，还支持 枚举的所有成员。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出了每个受支持的成员的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成员`DateTimeStyles` member|行为Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||分析 `input`，并在必要时将其转换为 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它等效于分析字符串，然后调用返回的 对象的 方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则会为返回的 对象提供本地时区的偏移量。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 这是默认值。This is the default value.| ||如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则会为返回的 对象提供 UTC 偏移量（+ 00:00）。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的内部空格。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by `format`. 日期和时间部分之间以及单个组件中可能出现额外空白，分析字符串时将忽略此空格。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components, and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的前导空格。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的尾随空格。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `format`未指定的前导空格、尾随空格和内部空格。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略 `format` 中未指定的所有额外空白字符。All extra white-space characters not specified in `format` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||指示 `input`中不允许使用额外的空白。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空格必须完全按照 `format`中指定的形式出现。White space must appear exactly as specified in `format`. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||不起作用，因为 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下面的示例将 方法与标准和自定义格式说明符、固定区域性以及各种 值一起使用来分析多个日期和时间字符串。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers, the invariant culture, and various values to parse several date and time strings. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact/cs/ParseExact.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact/vb/ParseExact.vb#2)] 下面的示例使用各种 值来分析应符合[ISO 8601](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier)的字符串数组。The following example uses a variety of values to parse an array of strings that are expected to conform to [ISO 8601](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier). 如示例的输出所示，格式正确的字符串在以下情况下无法分析：As the output from the example shows, strings that are in the proper format fail to parse if: - 它们包含空格，并且没有在方法调用中提供适当的 标志（如 。they contain white space, and an appropriate flag (such as has not been supplied in the method call. - 它们包含超出范围的日期和时间元素。they contain date and time elements that are out of range. 除非在方法调用中提供了 标志，否则不指定 UTC 偏移量的字符串将采用本地时区的偏移量（在本例中为-07:00）。Strings that do not specify a UTC offset are assumed to have the offset of the local time zone (in this case, -07:00) unless the flag is supplied in the method call. 在这种情况下，假定它们是协调世界时。In that case, they are assumed to be Universal Coordinated Time. [!code-csharp[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system/datetimeoffset/parseexact/parseexact-iso8601-2.cs)] [!code-vb[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system/datetimeoffset/parseexact/parseexact-iso8601-2.vb)]

`input` 与多个格式设置模式进行比较以外，此重载的行为与 方法相同。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple formatting patterns, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特别是，定义多个输入模式的功能使应用程序能够处理日期和时间表示形式，该表示形式可以包括或缺少前导零（以月、天、小时、分钟和秒为单位）。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 该示例提供了此的说明。The example provides an remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性不受 属性值的影响。The property is not affected by the value of the property. 属性的值表示自0001年1月1日午夜12:00:00 （的值）以来经过的100纳秒间隔数。The value of the property represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00:00 midnight on January 1, 0001 (the value of ). 它不包括闰秒将添加的时间刻度。It does not include ticks that would be added by leap seconds. 毫微秒为一秒的十亿分之一;第二个计时周期为10000000。A nanosecond is one billionth of a second; there are ten million ticks in a second. 属性的值范围是从 `DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks` 到 `DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`。The value of the property ranges from `DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks` to `DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`. 可以通过使用 构造函数重载，将计时周期数分配给 的对象。You can assign the number of ticks to a object by using the constructor overload. ## Examples 下面的示例通过逼近 1:23:07 2008 年7月1日中的计时周期数来初始化一个 对象。The following example initializes a object by approximating the number of ticks in the date July 1, 2008 1:23:07. 然后，它会将日期和该日期所表示的计时周期数显示到控制台。It then displays the date and the number of ticks represented by that date to the console. Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 当应用程序创建、访问或写入到文件时，Windows 将使用文件时间来记录。Windows uses a file time to record when an application creates, accesses, or writes to a file. 在执行转换之前， 方法会将当前 对象的日期和时间转换为 UTC。The method converts the current object's date and time to UTC before it performs the conversion. 换言之，调用 方法等效于以下方法调用：In other words, calling the method is equivalent to the following method call: ```csharp this.ToUtcDateTime().ToFileTime(); ``` ```vb Me.ToUtcDateTime().ToFileTime() ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在执行到本地时间的转换时，方法首先通过从时间中减去偏移量，将当前 对象的日期和时间转换为协调世界时（UTC）。In performing the conversion to local time, the method first converts the current object's date and time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) by subtracting the offset from the time. 然后，它通过添加本地时区偏移量将 UTC 日期和时间转换为本地时间。It then converts the UTC date and time to local time by adding the local time zone offset. 在执行此操作时，它会考虑本地时区的任何调整规则。In doing this, it takes account of any adjustment rules for the local time zone. 当前 对象的值和该方法调用返回的 对象的值都表示相同的时间点。Both the value of the current object and the value of the object returned by the method call represent the same point in time. 也就是说，如果两个传递到 方法，则方法将返回 `true`。That is, if both are passed to the method, the method will return `true`. 如果转换导致时间超出 类型的范围，则 方法返回 对象，该对象的日期和时间设置为 或 ，偏移量设置为本地时区偏移量。If the conversion causes a time that is out of range of the type, the method returns a object that has the date and time set to either or and the offset set to the local time zone offset. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将 值转换为太平洋标准时区中的本地时间。The following example uses the method to convert a value to local time in the Pacific Standard Time zone. 它还阐释了方法对本地时区的调整规则的支持。It also illustrates the method's support for the local time zone's adjustment rules. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法是调用 方法的替代方法。The method is an alternative to calling the method. 当时区与协调世界时（UTC）的偏移量已知时，此方法可用于执行从一个时区到另一个时区的简单转换。It can be useful for performing simple conversions from one time zone to another when the time zones' offsets from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) are known. 但是，因为原始 对象和方法调用返回的新 对象都不明确地与特定时区相关，所以此方法不会在转换中应用任何时区调整规则。However, because neither the original object nor the new object returned by the method call are unambiguously related to a particular time zone, the method does not apply any time zone adjustment rules in the conversion. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法将 对象转换为具有不同偏移量的 对象。The following example illustrates how to use the method to convert a object to a object with a different offset. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的返回值与其等效 方法重载的值相同，不同之处在于，它包括一个空格，后跟在字符串末尾追加的偏移量。The return value of this method is identical to that of its equivalent overload of the method, except that it includes a space followed by the offset appended at the end of the string. 换句话说，它使用短日期模式、长时间模式和 `zzz` 自定义格式字符串来设置输出的格式，每个元素都由一个空格与上一个元素隔开。In other words, it formats output using the short date pattern, the long time pattern, and the `zzz` custom format string, with each element separated from the previous element by a space. 这三个元素的格式由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The format of these three elements is defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示其格式设置约定应用于返回的字符串的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are applied to the returned string. 属性返回的 对象定义返回的字符串的格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象（请参阅 ）。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object associated with the current culture is used (see ). ## Examples 下面的示例使用表示固定区域性的 对象以及四个其他区域性显示 对象。The following example displays a object using objects that represent the invariant culture, as well as four other cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format` 参数应包含单个格式说明符（请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)）或自定义格式模式（请参阅[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)），该模式定义返回的字符串的格式。The `format` parameter should contain either a single format specifier character (see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)) or a custom format pattern (see [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)) that defines the format of the returned string. 如果 `format` 为 null 或空字符串（""），则 值是使用默认格式的输出。If `format` is a null or empty string (""), the value is output using the default format. 下表显示了在与 一起使用时特定格式说明符的确切操作，与 一起使用时，与它们的行为不同。The following table shows the exact operation of certain format specifiers when used with , which differs from their behavior when used with . |现有格式说明符Existing format specifier|新行为New behavior| |-------------------------------|------------------| |“K”"K"|旨在往返日期和时间。Designed to round-trip a date and time. 在 中，映射到 "zzz" （偏移量始终显示为小时和分钟）。With , maps to "zzz" (the offset is always displayed with hours and minutes). 请注意，"K" 是一个自定义格式说明符;它不能显示为 `format`中的单个字符。Note that "K" is a custom format specifier; it cannot appear as the single character in `format`.| |“U”"U"|不受支持。Not supported.| |迅驰"r"|将 对象转换为协调世界时（UTC），并使用自定义格式字符串 `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`输出该对象。Converts the object to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and outputs it using the custom format string `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`.| |“u”"u"|将 对象转换为 UTC，并使用格式 `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`输出。Converts the object to UTC and outputs it using the format `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`.| 其余标准日期和时间格式说明符与 方法的行为相同，与 方法相同。The remaining standard date and time format specifiers behave the same with the method as they do with the method. 此方法使用派生自当前区域性的格式设置信息。This method uses formatting information derived from the current culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅 。For more information, see . ## Examples 下面的示例使用每个标准日期和时间格式说明符向控制台显示一个 对象。The following example displays a object to the console using each of the standard date and time format specifiers. 使用 en-us 区域性设置输出的格式。The output is formatted by using the en-us culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format` 参数应包含单个格式说明符（请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)）或自定义格式模式（请参阅[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)）。The `format` parameter should contain either a single format specifier character (see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)) or a custom format pattern (see [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)). 如果 `format` 为 null 或空字符串（""），则使用默认格式输出 对象。If `format` is a null or empty string (""), the object is output using the default format. 下表显示了在与 一起使用时特定格式说明符的确切操作，与 一起使用时，与它们的行为不同。The following table shows the exact operation of certain format specifiers when used with , which differs from their behavior when used with . |现有格式说明符Existing format specifier|新行为New behavior| |-------------------------------|------------------| |“K”"K"|旨在往返日期和时间。Designed to round-trip a date and time. 在 中，映射到 "zzz" （偏移量始终显示为小时和分钟）。With , maps to "zzz" (the offset is always displayed with hours and minutes). 请注意，"K" 是一个自定义格式说明符;它不能显示为 `format`中的单个字符。Note that "K" is a custom format specifier; it cannot appear as the single character in `format`.| |“U”"U"|不受支持。Not supported.| |迅驰"r"|将 对象转换为协调世界时（UTC），并使用自定义格式字符串 `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`输出该对象。Converts the object to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and outputs it using the custom format string `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`.| |“u”"u"|将 值转换为 UTC，并使用格式 `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`输出。Converts the value to UTC and outputs it using the format `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`.| 其余标准日期和时间格式说明符与 方法的行为相同，与 方法相同。The remaining standard date and time format specifiers behave the same with the method as they do with the method. 对应于标准格式说明符的模式以及日期和时间组件的符号和名称由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The pattern that corresponds to standard format specifiers, as well as the symbols and names of date and time components, is defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示在 `input`中使用其格式设置的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting is used in `input`. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中使用的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting used in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatProvider`，则使用与当前区域性关联的 对象（请参阅 ）。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object associated with the current culture is used (see ). ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法，使用多个不同的区域性的自定义格式字符串来显示 对象。The following example uses the method to display a object using a custom format string for several different cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks Unix time 表示自 1970-01-01T00：00：00Z （1970年1月1日上午 12:00 AM UTC）起已过去的秒数。Unix time represents the number of seconds that have elapsed since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z (January 1, 1970, at 12:00 AM UTC). 它不会考虑闰秒的时间。It does not take leap seconds into account. 此方法返回 Unix 时间中的毫秒数。This method returns the number of milliseconds in Unix time. 此方法首先将当前实例转换为 UTC，然后再返回其 Unix 时间中的毫秒数。This method first converts the current instance to UTC before returning the number of milliseconds in its Unix time. 对于 1970-01-01T00：00：00Z 之前的日期和时间值，此方法返回一个负值。For date and time values before 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z, this method returns a negative value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法的此重载与 方法类似，不同之处在于，它不会在转换失败时引发异常。This overload of the method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 它分析一个字符串，其中包含三个元素，这些元素可按任意顺序出现并由空格分隔。It parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 下表显示了这三个元素。These three elements are shown in the following table. |元素Element|示例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<时间 >\|"1:02:03 PM""1:02:03 PM"| |\<偏移 >\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 尽管其中的每个元素都是可选的，但 > \<偏移量不能单独出现。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必须与 \<日期 > 或 \<时间 > 一起提供。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果缺少 \<日期 >，则其默认值为当前日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果存在 \<日期 > 但其年份组成部分只包含两个数字，则将根据 属性的值将其转换为当前区域性当前日历中的年份。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the current culture's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果缺少 \<时间 >，则其默认值为 12:00:00 AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果缺少 \，则其默认值为本地时区的偏移量。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone. 如果存在 \，则它可以表示与协调世界时（UTC）之间的负值或正偏移量。If \ is present, it can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情况下，\<偏移 > 必须包括符号符号或方法返回 `false`。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol or the method returns `false`. `input` 字符串使用为当前区域性初始化 对象中的格式设置信息进行分析。The `input` string is parsed by using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current culture. 若要分析包含指定格式的字符串，该字符串不一定对应于当前区域性的指定格式设置，请使用 方法并提供格式说明符。To parse a string that contains designated formatting that does not necessarily correspond to that of the current culture, use the method and provide a format specifier. ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法来分析多个具有各种日期和时间格式的字符串。The following example calls the method to parse several strings with various date and time formats. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法的此重载与 方法类似，不同之处在于，它不会在转换失败时引发异常。This overload of the method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 方法分析一个字符串，其中包含三个元素，这些元素可按任意顺序出现并由空格分隔。The method parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 下表显示了这三个元素。These three elements are shown in the following table. |元素Element|示例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<时间 >\|"1:02:03 PM""1:02:03 PM"| |\<偏移 >\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 尽管其中的每个元素都是可选的，但 > \<偏移量不能单独出现。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必须与 \<日期 > 或 \<时间 > 一起提供。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果缺少 \<日期 >，则其默认值为当前日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果存在 \<日期 > 但其年份组成部分只包含两个数字，则将根据 属性的值将其转换为 `provider` 参数的当前日历中的年份。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the `provider` parameter's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果缺少 \<时间 >，则其默认值为 12:00:00 AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果缺少 \，则其默认值为本地时区的偏移量，如果在 中指定了 或 `styles`值，则为 。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone, or if either the or value is specified in `styles`. 如果存在 \，则它可以表示与协调世界时（UTC）之间的负值或正偏移量。If \ is present, it can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情况下，\<偏移 > 必须包括符号符号或方法返回 `false`。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol or the method returns `false`. `input` 字符串使用 `formatProvider` 参数提供的 对象中的区域性特定格式设置信息进行分析。The `input` string is parsed by using the culture-specific formatting information in a object supplied by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示在 `input`中使用其格式设置的区域性。A object that represents the culture whose formatting is used in `input`. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中使用的格式。The object returned by the property defines the format that is used in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 此外，每个元素可以用前导或尾随空格分隔，并且 \<日期 > 和 \<时间 > 组件可以包含内部空格（如 6: 00:00）。In addition, each element can be delimited by leading or trailing white space, and the \ and \ components can include inner white space (such as 6: 00:00). 仅 > 组件的 \<偏移量不能包含内部空格。Only the \ component cannot include inner white space. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. \ 使用正号或负号，必须是 + 或-。The positive or negative sign used in \ must be either + or -. 它不是由 `formatprovider` 参数的 属性返回的 对象的 或 属性来定义的。It is not defined by the or properties of the object returned by the `formatprovider` parameter's property. 支持 枚举的以下成员：The following members of the enumeration are supported: |DateTimeStyles 成员DateTimeStyles Member|CommentsComments| |---------------------------|--------------| ||分析由 `input` 表示的字符串，如有必要，将其转换为 UTC。Parses the string represented by `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它等效于分析字符串，然后调用返回对象的 方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the returned object's method.| ||虽然有效，但会忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. \<日期 > 和 \<时间 > 组件允许内部空格。Inner white space is allowed in the \ and \ components.| ||虽然有效，但会忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. 分析字符串中的每个组件的前面都允许使用前导空格。Leading white space is allowed in front of each component in the parsed string.| ||虽然有效，但会忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. 分析字符串中的每个组件的前面都允许尾随空格。Trailing white space is allowed in front of each component in the parsed string.| ||此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior. 不能通过提供限制性更强的 枚举值（如 ）来重写它。It cannot be overridden by supplying a more restrictive enumeration value, such as .| ||指示如果 `input` 参数缺少 \<偏移量 > 元素，则应提供本地时区的偏移量。Indicates that, if the `input` parameter lacks an \ element, the offset of the local time zone should be provided. 这是 方法的默认行为。This is the default behavior of the method.| ||指示如果 `input` 参数缺少 \<偏移量 > 元素，则应提供 UTC 偏移量（00:00）。Indicates that, if the `input` parameter lacks an \ element, the UTC offset (00:00) should be provided.| ||虽然有效，但此值将被忽略且不起作用。Although valid, this value is ignored and has no effect.| ||由于 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性，因此此值无效。Because the structure does not include a `Kind` property, this value has no effect.| 仅 值不受支持。Only the value is not supported. 如果 `styles` 参数中包含此值，则会引发 。An is thrown if this value is included in the `styles` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例使用各种 值调用 方法，以分析具有各种日期和时间格式的字符串。The following example calls the method with a variety of values to parse some strings with various date and time formats. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此重载类似于 方法，但如果转换失败，则此方法不会引发异常。This overload is like the method, except that this method does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 它分析日期和时间的表示形式，该日期和时间必须与 `format` 参数指定的模式完全匹配。It parses the representation of a date and time that must exactly match the pattern specified by the `format` parameter. 如果 `input` 与此模式不匹配，并且 `styles` 参数定义的空白中有一些可能的变体，则分析操作将失败，并且该方法将返回 `false`。If `input` does not match this pattern, with some possible variations in white space defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. `format` 参数是一个字符跨度，其中包含单个标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 `input`所需模式的自定义格式说明符。The `format` parameter is a character span that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required pattern of `input`. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `format` 包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移必须包含负号或正号。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则分析操作将失败，并且方法将返回 `false`。If the sign is missing, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `format` 要求 `input` 包含时间而不包含日期，则生成的 对象将被分配到本地系统上的当前日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `styles` 参数的值。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将本地时区的偏移量分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将协调世界时（UTC）偏移量或 + 00:00 分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果这两个值均未指定，则使用本地时区的偏移量。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. `input` 中使用的特定日期和时间符号和字符串由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. by the property defines the symbols and standard formats allowed in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles` 参数定义在输入字符串中是否允许空格，指示如何分析没有显式偏移量组件的字符串，并支持在分析操作中进行 UTC 转换。The `styles` parameter defines whether remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法分析与分配给 `formats` 数组的模式之一匹配的日期的字符串表示形式。This method parses the string representation of a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` array. 如果 `input` 与这些模式中的任何一种模式都不匹配 `styles` 参数定义的任何变体，则分析操作将失败，并且该方法将返回 `false`。If `input` does not match any one of these patterns with any variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 除了将 `input` 与包含格式说明符的多个字符串进行比较以外，此重载的行为与 方法相同。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple strings that contain format specifiers, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 `input`的可能模式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of `input`. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配的元素包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移量必须包括负号或正负号。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则分析操作将失败，并且方法将返回 `false`。If the sign is missing, the parse operation fails and the method returns `false`. > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用此重载的 `formats` 参数指定多种格式可帮助减少许多用户在输入日期和时间时遇到的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特别是，定义多个输入模式的功能使应用程序能够处理日期和时间表示形式，该表示形式可以包括或缺少前导零（以月、天、小时、分钟和秒为单位）。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 该示例提供了此的说明。The example provides an illustration of this. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求输入包含时间而不包含日期，则将在本地系统上向生成的 对象分配当前日期。If the matched element in `formats` requires that input contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `styles` 参数的值。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将本地时区的偏移量分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将协调世界时（UTC）偏移量或 + 00:00 分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果这两个值均未指定，则使用本地时区的偏移量。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. `input` 中使用的特定日期和时间符号由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The particular date and time symbols used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 如果 `formats` 的匹配元素是标准格式说明符字符串，则 `input` 的精确模式也是如此。The same is true for the precise pattern of `input` if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示基于其解释 `input` 的区域性。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中的符号和格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles` 参数定义在输入字符串中是否允许空格，指示如何分析没有显式偏移量组件的字符串，并支持在分析操作中进行 UTC 转换。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is permitted in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 除 之外，还支持 枚举的所有成员。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出了每个受支持的成员的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成员`DateTimeStyles` member|行为Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||分析 `input`，并在必要时将其转换为 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它等效于分析字符串，然后调用返回的 对象的 方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供本地时区的偏移量。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 这是默认值。This is the default value.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供 UTC 偏移量（+ 00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||允许 `input` 包括 `formats`中的元素未指定的内部空格。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by the elements in `formats`. 在对字符串进行分析时，日期和时间部分以及单个组件（除偏移量以外）中都可以出现额外的空白。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except for the offset) and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的前导空格。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的尾随空格。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的前导空格、尾随空格和内部空格。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略在 `formats` 中的匹配元素中未指定的所有额外空白字符。All extra white-space characters not specified in the matched element in `formats` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||指示 `input`中不允许使用额外的空白。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空格必须完全按照 `formats` 中的特定元素指定，才能成功匹配。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element in `formats` for a successful match to occur. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||不起作用，因为 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.|

calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则会为返回的 对象提供本地时区的偏移量。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||如果 `format` 不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则会为返回的 对象提供 UTC 偏移量（+ 00:00）。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||允许 `input` 包含格式未指定的内部空格。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by format. 在对字符串进行分析时，日期和时间部分之间以及单个组件（而不是偏移量）之间可能会出现额外的空白。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components, other than the offset, and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的前导空格。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包括 `format`未指定的尾随空格。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `format`未指定的前导空格、尾随空格和内部空格。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `format`. 分析字符串时，将忽略 `format` 中未指定的所有额外空白字符。All extra white-space characters not specified in `format` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||指示 `input`中不允许使用额外的空白。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空格必须完全按照 `format`中指定的形式出现。White space must appear exactly as specified in `format`. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||不起作用，因为 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性。Has no effect, because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下面的示例将 方法与标准和自定义格式说明符、固定区域性以及各种 值一起使用来分析多个日期和时间字符串。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers, the invariant culture, and various values to parse several date and time strings. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/cs/TryParseExact.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/vb/TryParseExact.vb#1)] 下面的示例使用各种 值来分析应符合[ISO 8601](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier)的字符串数组。The following example uses a variety of values to parse an array of strings that are expected to conform to [ISO 8601](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier). 如示例的输出所示，格式正确的字符串在以下情况下无法分析：As the output from the example shows, strings that are in the proper format fail to parse if: - 它们包含空格，并且没有在方法调用中提供适当的 标志（如 。they contain white space, and an appropriate flag (such as has not been supplied in the method call. - 它们包含超出范围的日期和时间元素。they contain date and time elements that are out of range. 除非在方法调用中提供了 标志，否则不指定 UTC 偏移量的字符串将采用本地时区的偏移量（在本例中为-07:00，表示太平洋夏令时时区的偏移量）。Strings that do not specify a UTC offset are assumed to have the offset of the local time zone (in this case, -07:00, which reflects the offset of the Pacific Daylight Time zone) unless the flag is supplied in the method call. 在这种情况下，假定它们是协调世界时。In that case, they are assumed to be Universal Coordinated Time. [!code-csharp[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system/datetimeoffset/tryparseexact/tryparseexacto8601-2.cs)] [!code-vb[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system/datetimeoffset/tryparseexact/tryparseexacto8601-2.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法分析与分配给 `formats` 数组的任一模式相匹配的日期的字符串表示形式。The method parses the string representation of a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` array. 如果 `input` 字符串与这些模式中的任何一种模式都不匹配 `styles` 参数定义的任何变体，则分析操作将失败，并且该方法将返回 `false`。If the `input` string does not match any one of these patterns with any variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 除了将 `input` 与包含格式说明符的多个字符串进行比较以外，此重载的行为与 方法相同。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple strings that contain format specifiers, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats` 参数是一个字符串数组，其元素包含单个标准格式说明符，或者包含一个或多个定义 `input`的可能模式的自定义格式说明符。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of `input`. 有关有效格式设置代码的详细信息，请参阅[标准日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings)和[自定义日期和时间格式字符串](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配的元素包括 `z`、`zz`或 `zzz` 自定义格式说明符，以指示在 `input`中必须存在偏移量，则该偏移量必须包括负号或正负号。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果缺少符号，则分析操作将失败，并且方法将返回 `false`。If the sign is missing, the parse operation fails and the method returns `false`. > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用此重载的 `formats` 参数指定多种格式可帮助减少许多用户在输入日期和时间时遇到的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特别是，定义多个输入模式的功能使应用程序能够处理日期和时间表示形式，该表示形式可以包括或缺少前导零（以月、天、小时、分钟和秒为单位）。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 该示例提供了此的说明。The example provides an illustration of this. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求 `input` 包含日期但不包含时间，则生成的 对象的时间为午夜（0:00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素要求输入包含时间而不包含日期，则将在本地系统上向生成的 对象分配当前日期。If the matched element in `formats` requires that input contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含偏移量，则生成的 对象的偏移量取决于 `styles` 参数的值。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将本地时区的偏移量分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果 `styles` 包括 ，则会将协调世界时（UTC）偏移量或 + 00:00 分配给 对象。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果这两个值均未指定，则使用本地时区的偏移量。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. `input` 中使用的特定日期和时间符号和字符串由 `formatProvider` 参数定义。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 如果 `formats` 的匹配元素是标准格式说明符字符串，则 `input` 的精确模式也是如此。The same is true for the precise pattern of `input` if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider` 参数可以是以下项之一：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - 一个 对象，该对象表示基于其解释 `input` 的区域性。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 属性返回的 对象定义 `input`中的符号和格式设置。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - 一个 对象，该对象定义日期和时间数据的格式。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果 `null``formatprovider`，则使用与当前区域性对应的 对象。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles` 参数定义在输入字符串中是否允许空格，指示如何分析没有显式偏移量组件的字符串，并支持在分析操作中进行 UTC 转换。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is permitted in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 除 之外，还支持 枚举的所有成员。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出了每个受支持的成员的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成员`DateTimeStyles` member|行为Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||分析 `input`，并在必要时将其转换为 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它等效于分析字符串，然后调用返回的 对象的 方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供本地时区的偏移量。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 这是默认值。This is the default value.| ||如果 `formats` 中的匹配元素不要求 `input` 包含 offset 值，则将为返回的 对象提供 UTC 偏移量（+ 00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||允许 `input` 包括 `formats`中的元素未指定的内部空格。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by the elements in `formats`. 在对字符串进行分析时，日期和时间部分以及单个组件（除偏移量以外）中都可以出现额外的空白。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except for the offset) and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的前导空格。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的尾随空格。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略这些字符。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||允许 `input` 包含 `formats`中的元素未指定的前导空格、尾随空格和内部空格。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 分析字符串时，将忽略在 `formats` 中的匹配元素中未指定的所有额外空白字符。All extra white-space characters not specified in the matched element in `formats` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||指示 `input`中不允许使用额外的空白。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空格必须完全按照 `formats` 中的特定元素指定，才能成功匹配。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element in `formats` for a successful match to occur. 此选项为默认行为。This is the default behavior.| ||不起作用，因为 结构不包括 `Kind` 属性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下面的示例为日期和时间和偏移量值的字符串表示形式定义多个输入格式，然后将用户输入的字符串传递给 方法。The following example defines multiple input formats for the string representation of a date and time and offset value, and then passes the string that is entered by the user to the method. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/cs/TryParseExact.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/vb/TryParseExact.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性执行双重转换：The property performs a dual conversion: - 它将当前 对象的日期和时间转换为协调世界时（UTC）。It converts the date and time of the current object to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 通过从当前 对象的日期和时间减去 属性的值来执行转换。The conversion is performed by subtracting the value of the property from the date and time of the current object. - 它将 值转换为 值。It converts the value to a value. 返回的 值的 属性设置为 。The property of the returned value is set to . 检索 属性的值等效于调用当前 对象的 `ToUniversalTime.DateTime` 属性，只不过后一 值的 属性 。Retrieving the value of the property is equivalent to calling the current object's `ToUniversalTime.DateTime` property, except that the property of the latter value is . ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 属性来显示 值及其相应的 UTC 时间。The following example shows how to use of the property to display a value and its corresponding UTC time. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Properties#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Properties/cs/Properties.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Properties#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Properties/vb/Properties.vb#17)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性基于本地系统的时钟时间和本地系统时区定义的偏移量来计算当前协调世界时（UTC）。The property computes the current Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) based on the local system's clock time and an offset defined by the local system's time zone. 当前 UTC 时间的毫秒部分的精度取决于系统时钟的分辨率。The precision of the current UTC time's millisecond component depends on the resolution of the system clock. 在 Windows NT 3.5 和更高版本以及 Windows Vista 操作系统上，时钟的分辨率大约为 10-15 毫秒。On Windows NT 3.5 and later, and Windows Vista operating systems, the clock's resolution is approximately 10-15 milliseconds. ## Examples 下面的示例说明协调世界时（UTC）与本地时间之间的关系。The following example illustrates the relationship between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Properties#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Properties/cs/Properties.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Properties#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Properties/vb/Properties.vb#18)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性的值表示自0001年1月1日午夜12:00:00 （的值）以来经过的100纳秒间隔数。The value of the property represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00:00 midnight on January 1, 0001 (the value of ). 它不包括闰秒将添加的时间刻度。It does not include ticks that would be added by leap seconds. 毫微秒为一秒的十亿分之一;第二个计时周期为10000000。A nanosecond is one billionth of a second; there are ten million ticks in a second. 属性的值范围是从 `DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks` 到 `DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`。The value of the property ranges from `DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks` to `DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`.

span.span: Gets the year component of the date represented by the current object.

value.span: 当前 对象的年份组成部分，以 0 到 9999 之间的一个整数值来表示。

span.span: The year component of the current object, expressed as an integer value between 0 and 9999.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性不受 属性值的影响。The property is not affected by the value of the property. 您还可以通过使用 "y"、"yy" 或 "yyyy" 自定义格式说明符调用 方法来创建 对象的年组成部分的字符串表示形式。You can also create a string representation of a object's year component by calling the method with the "y", "yy", or "yyyy" custom format specifiers. ## Examples 下面的示例以四种不同的方式显示 值的年份部分：The following example displays the year component of a value in four different ways: - 通过检索 属性的值。By retrieving the value of the property. - 通过使用 "y" 格式说明符调用 方法。By calling the method with the "y" format specifier. - 通过使用 "yy" 格式说明符调用 方法。By calling the method with the "yy" format specifier. - 通过使用 "yyyy" 格式说明符调用 方法。By calling the method with the "yyyy" format specifier.
